title: How to Make a Glitter Mask

steps.headline: Gather your supplies.
steps.description:
The following supplies can be found at any craft store. A blank mask
Acrylic or tempera paint in a range of colors. (If you have a tight budget, buy yellow, blue, red, and black) With the paint, you will need paintbrushes in many sizes. Glitter. There are many ways to buy glitter, but I suggest glitter glue for small accents and loose glitter for bit impact. Glue. Like glitter, glue can be bought in many different forms. I suggest tacky glue for sequins, mod podge for large loose glitter, and spray glue or mod podge for fine loose glitter. Any other accents you find. These may be feathers, ribbon, or fabric flowers. If you decide to buy these, I suggest buying a hot glue gun to glue them on to the mask.

steps.headline: Start by painting your mask a base color.
steps.description: This color will be the mask's main color. You may want to make this the lightest color, as you will be painting over it with other colors. If you just bought yellow, blue, and red, and you want to make other colors, you can mix colors to create green, orange, and purple.

steps.headline: Start decorating!
steps.description: Paint intricate lines of fun colors, or a nice pattern! Some ideas are: flowers, stripes, swirls, or anything you can think of. Go crazy!

steps.headline: Add the glitter.
steps.description: Put glue in the areas you want glitter, then put the glitter on. Once the glue had dried, shake or brush off the excess glitter. If you want the whole mask covered in glitter,cover the whole mask in glue with a paintbrush and pour on the glitter! If you want, glue your extra accents on with a hot glue gun!

steps.headline: Allow to dry and show off your mask and make everyone jealous!
